timeline.title: Agreement Effective Date
timeline.description: Agreement takes effect contingent upon prior approval by COMMISSION governing board. CONSULTANT commences work after notification to proceed by COMMISSION's Contract Manager.

timeline.title: First Progress Report and Invoice Submission
timeline.description: CONSULTANT submits first written progress report with itemized invoice within 45 calendar days after performance of work, including labor details, expenses, and progress report.

timeline.title: Monthly Progress Payment Due
timeline.description: COMMISSION makes progress payment no less than monthly in arrears based on satisfactory services and actual allowable incurred costs, including pro rata fixed fee if applicable.

timeline.title: Insurance Certificate Renewal
timeline.description: CONSULTANT provides new Certificate of Insurance if coverage expires, with at least 30 days prior notice, subject to COMMISSION approval.

timeline.title: Agreement End Date
timeline.description: Agreement ends unless earlier terminated or extended by contract amendment.

penalty_forecast.description: Late payment penalty for invoice submission beyond 45 days, plus potential interest at 2% per month on overdue amounts.
Additional penalties for continued non-compliance with insurance requirements or missed milestones, plus reprocurement costs if terminated for default.
Severe penalties for breach of agreement terms, including indemnification claims and legal fees, up to ₹1,000,000 for professional liability issues.

exit_comparisons.label: Termination for Convenience by COMMISSION
exit_comparisons.penalty_text: ₹0 (no penalty, but CONSULTANT receives allowable costs incurred)

exit_comparisons.label: Termination for Default by COMMISSION
exit_comparisons.benefits_lost: All future payments and reputation damage

narratives.title: Timely Performance and Compliance
narratives.subtitle: Ideal scenario with all milestones met
narratives.narrative: CONSULTANT submits progress reports and invoices on time, COMMISSION approves payments promptly, and the project completes successfully by the end date. All insurance and legal requirements are maintained, resulting in full payment of ₹500,000 and positive relationship for future contracts.

narratives.title: Late Invoice Submission
narratives.subtitle: CONSULTANT misses 45-day invoice deadline
narratives.narrative: CONSULTANT submits invoice 60 days after work performance, triggering COMMISSION's right to delay payment. Interest accrues at 2% per month on overdue amounts. Repeated delays may lead to termination for default under Section 4.B, incurring reprocurement costs of ₹50,000.

narratives.title: Insurance Lapse
narratives.subtitle: CONSULTANT fails to renew insurance coverage
narratives.narrative: CONSULTANT's insurance expires without renewal or notice, violating Section 6.B.5. COMMISSION issues a 10-day cure notice. If not resolved, COMMISSION terminates the agreement, and CONSULTANT faces penalties up to ₹100,000 for breach and additional insured claims.

risk_alerts.message: Failure to maintain required insurance coverage may result in immediate termination and significant financial penalties under Section 6.B.5.
Late submission of invoices beyond 45 days can lead to payment delays, interest charges, and potential termination under Section 2.E.
Non-compliance with equal employment opportunity laws under Section 8 may result in contract cancellation and ineligibility for future agreements.
Unauthorized subcontracting or changes to key personnel without COMMISSION approval breaches Section 1.C and 20, risking termination and penalties.
